Reviews.Title: “Weekend break”
Reviews.Author: rustybhoy
Reviews.Content: Hotel is ok, the toilets and bathrooms were spotless! We got upgraded to the suite however this was just near to the reception and the doors seemed to be made of paper as we could hear the receptionist and guests! Not good when youre trying to get some sleep and the door buzzer goes off all the time. The rooms however were very clean and modern! Bit pricey considering the hotel is not that new. Overall not bad for stag/hen weekends i suppose but not if you want a quite hotel to relax with your partner

Reviews.Title: “Awful Hotel, Couldn't wait to leave”
Reviews.Author: LynseyJ
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights in the Hotel de Paris in Amsterdam which very nearly ruined my opinion of a beautiful city. Luckily there's so much to do in Amsterdam and the city is gorgeous that you don't need to spend too much time in your hotel room. On arriving at the hotel the whole place stank of smoke, the staff were haughty and unhelpful and the room tiny, dark, overlooking a square of tarmac littered with cigarette butts (promised a balcony room!) and ridiculously over-priced for what it was. No kettle, no mugs, no glasses, lino on the floor, rubbish hair dryer, shouting and banging all throught the night and I really could not wait to leave the place.

Reviews.Title: “Teeny room but well kept and clean. Good value for money.”
Reviews.Author: Inliferound
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed at Hotel de Paris for a weekend in February. It was freezing cold (and snowing!) in Amsterdam when we arrived but we werent prepared for it so the hotel room was a good place to take refuge. The room was really small, with a tiny heater that didn't really heat the room up as fast as we'd wanted but eveything was clean and the reception staff were really friendly. We were located in Leidsplein (?sp) which we found was a good location, we were able to walk to Anne Frank Huis and explore the city on foot.

Reviews.Title: “Very expensive. Rooms too small.”
Reviews.Content: Situated in a central location, it's overpriced and rooms are very small.

Reviews.Title: “A good value for the money.”
Reviews.Author: macrophage
Reviews.Content: Hotel de Paris - Trip advisor For starters, Â I traveled to Amsterdam unplanned because it was a spur of the moment thing so I reserved this hotel very quickly and while a few bad reviews made me think twice about it, I didn't paid any attention to it and it paid off.Â  First of all, this is not a fancy hotel nor a new or recently remoleded one, this hotel is just perfect for a solo traveler or a couple who isn't very picky, for me as a solo traveler, I'm not to fond of staying at hostels but don't have a lot of money for a pricey one but Hotel de Paris fits just perfectly. The prices is in the range of a Motel 6 and has every basic thing: a bed, closet, free safebox, bathroom, hot shower, television, hair dryer and an elevator.Â  Now, Amsterdam is a very old city and therefore the hotel is quite old and musty but it has its charm, it is quite conviently located a kilometer away from the heart of the city and a few more meters from central station. If you are carrying a backpack, it would take about fifteen minutes to walk from central station to the hotel, and if you're carrying more stuff and/or don't want to walk, just take the 172 bus from central station and it is a brisk ten minute drive to Raampein stop were it is in front of the hotel. The trip will cost â‚¬2. I recommend the "I amsterdam" pass for three days, with it you can take the city's tram and bus services, and can get into the most important Â museums in town. As for me, the real treat was to rent a bike, which costs between â‚¬10 to â‚¬15 per day, as just rode arount Amsterdam, it is amazing how many people use this transportation method, I wish I lived in a city like it but I digress.Â  Some of the rooms have a very distinct smell of old so for the faint of heart I recommend to use a room deodorant that can be easily bought in a store or better yet bring one from the US, obviously much cheaper, and just plug it in the electrical outlet just don't forget to Â buy your American-European converter because it will cost you double in Holland. Buy one from eBay, they're so cheap it's ridiculous and they work nicely.Â  One of the best things is the hotel staff, they're very kind and welcoming, it just feels like a bed and breakfast, and speaking of breakfast, it is included in the hotel fee as a contentinental but not like in the US were it is just bread, butter and old coffee, at Hotel de Paris it is a real treat with quite a charming room. I had such a good breakfast that I looked forward to it every morning.Â  The drawbacks is that it is a bit noisy because of the streets and the other rooms so, if you can, request a room from the back, those are less noisy, and watch out for the stairsa because they're seemed to be made for children, I'm 5' 11" and almost loose my footing a couple of times.Â  Overall, I recommend this hotel for all travelers who just want a nice, private and centric room at good price. I will defintely will reserve again in this hotel next time I visit Amsterdam. Any questions please feel free to send a message, I will answer as best as I can.Â

Reviews.Title: “Average but Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: prakdora
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is good and close to Leidsplein square. Rooms are very small but comfortable for one night stay. Only the reception area is rather confusing to locate as some work is going on everywhere. Open the lift and you find a lot of materials still left there. Breakfast is OK. Overall the room is comfortable althogh the bath room is rally small to move around. Looking to the price it is value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap - But Not Cheerful!!!”
Reviews.Author: kimw w
Reviews.Content: Having just returned - yesterday! I have only two positive things to say regarding this Hotel. It is cheap, and the location is good. But I would suggest, to save a bit longer, pay a bit extra!! and don't stay here. When we arrived. The so called bar area! was being worked on. The entrance, reception area photos, as displayed on their website, is nothing in reality. There are no tea, coffee making facilities. You have to ask for a ' complimentary cup of tea ', which in truth, is a pot of hot water, provided with a couple of tea bags, and milk if you are lucky, from whomever is in charge of reception, answering the buzzer that day!!. Most alarming of all. As found in our room, was the obvious underfloor leak. Our two night stay, meant we had to lay a copious amount of towels, over an obvious leak. I dare to say sewer, emanating from the toilet/shower area. I have to say the chambermaids were wonderful. The reception, seemed non plussed!!

Reviews.Title: “Small but comfortable”
Reviews.Author: bikermice
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights. Our room was small, but it was enough for the two of us and we found it comfortable. Our room was warm and had a big window that you could open. The bathroom was quite small, but it was clean and the shower was really lovely. The breakfast was great. They had really gone to a lot of effort to make it the best 'continental' breakfast ever. Cute touches like a basket full of hard boiled eggs wrapped in a cloth made us feel like we were staying at Gradmas house. We found the staff generally good and the fact that they are available 24 hours means you don't need to lug (and loose) your key. The price was really reasonable for the service and the location. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, great location, but odd staff...”
Reviews.Author: Punchayouface
Reviews.Content: Our room was a bit small, but you should only be there to sleep and shower in between venturing out and exploring the city anyway. When I travel to new cities, all I really need is a clean room with a bed that I can sleep well in, and this fit the bill; the beds were really comfortable and everything was pretty clean. The bathroom was very modern looking and was pretty large considering the size of the room itself. I also really enjoyed eating breakfast out in the lobby/bar area in the mornings. The breakfast was the best continental breakfast I've ever had at a hotel; I remember scrambled eggs, deli meat and cheeses, tons of fruit and breads, and lots of juices to choose from. My only complaint is that we came across a staff member that acted pretty peculiar. My female friend and I were greeted by this really friendly (maybe too friendly) guy who checked us in, gave us our key, and then gave us directions on how to find the room. We get in there, unpack a bit and relax when suddenly the man, who checked us in just minutes before, opens the door to our room and walks in. We jump, because we're not expecting anyone to come into the room, and he acts startled, too, then just turns around on his heel and walks out of the room without a word. My first thought was, "Wow. we're a couple of huge idiots for not locking the hotel room door behind us" and my second thought was, "Pretty strange, considering he just gave us a key to this room, told us directions to this room, and we made it pretty obvious we were coming straight up to this room." My friend joked that maybe he was hoping to walk in on the two of us girls right in the middle of a topless pillow bed on top of one of the beds, but joking aside, we were still wary by his unexplainable behavior. From then on, we were sure to lock the deadbolt when we were in the room, and we took absolutely all of our valuables with us when we left for the day to explore. My friend chose this hotel for us. I would say that for the most part she picked well as far as it's location and price goes. I think the next time I travel to Amsterdam, I might be more comfortable staying at this hotel with my boyfriend then I would by myself or with another female again, but on the other hand, I wasn't so completely blown away by this place that I would absolutely stay here again. I think I will use this website in hopes of finding a better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Small, clean and comfortable with excellent breakfast”
Reviews.Author: 6train51
Reviews.Content: Helpful staff. Room small but clean and comfortable. 20 minute walk from Dam square. Breakfast excellent and staff helpful. Internet available but too expensive. Go to cafe across street where it's free.

Reviews.Title: “good location but ....”
Reviews.Author: tomboycott
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very well located and the breakfast was good but the rooms were very smalll with no outlook at all. this area is very nice but if i went again i would pay more for a better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Rooms, Well Located, Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: GuapoBumsies
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel - looks run down from the outside but updated inside and room I was given was large and had an updated bathroom - very comfortable and located close to the square, rijksmuseum, heineken factory tour, lot's of restaurants, theaters etc.. steps away. Great value above all, if you're interested in seeing the city for up to 2 days, why waste the $$ staying at a fancy place when this one is a great base for exploring as long as you get a great deal - I paid $63/night w/ taxes

Reviews.Title: “Good location, helpful reception, but mind the rude guy with a paunch”
Reviews.Author: devanand0000000000
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located for any further exploration. There was one rude receptionist who greeted us with a - are you deaf. This was so as this is the first hotel we have come across which has a bell that has to be pressed. Since we pressed it twice this paunchy man got wild and yelled at us- are you deaf. How were we to know that one has to press the door after the buzz is heard. But, after that he was quite kind and helpful when we showed our displeasure though he thought nothing wring in what he said. He gave good tips on how to save money and showed us the way to vegetarian restaurants. the room was tiny as was the lift. the room was too small for the money that was paid. the breakfast was adequate though the waiters were keen that you chose your option of tea and coffee when you sat down and not call them later. But the location is very good as you can walk to any aprt of the city- the dam square or the Van Gough muesuem or anywhere for that matter. Tea and coffee is on the house between 10 and 8 pm. But you ahve to sit at the bar and not the tables which are meant for brakfast. Looks like that they have few staff to clean up. worth visiting even though the paunchy man will yell at you.

Reviews.Title: “A great little find......”
Reviews.Author: GLR2
Reviews.Content: after arriving in Amsterdam only to discover our accomodation had been double booked we stumbled across this little gem at 11.00 p.m when we thought all hope was lost!! The staff were welcoming and extremely helpful -they had to jiggle things to fit us in for all 3 nights of our stay which involved one room change. The rooms were small but spotlessly clean. Beds were comfy and the bathroom(s) were nicely decorated with excellent showers. Breakfast was nice and although there were no tea/coffee facilities in the rooms the staff were always happy to make complimentary drinks for guests at anytime - which was a nice touch. This place wasn't luxury accomodation but if you are looking for a great base, somewhere central - thats clean, comfortable and friendly then this is it.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget hotel for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: DawlishEnglandDebbie
Reviews.Content: Went to Amsterdam for the weekend with 2 other couples. Booked 3 small double rooms directly with the hotel, paid â‚¬89 per room, per night. Caught the 197 bus from the airport to Leidsplein, hotel was just a few minutes walk from the bus stop. Rooms were clean, very compact, with adequate bathroom. Nice breakfast, cereals, fruit, chesse, meats and various breads and coissants. Also scambled eggs were available. Very good location, would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE SERVICE. The blatant rudeness of the concierge made my stay VERY unpleasant.”
Reviews.Author: mikerein555
Reviews.Content: BEWARE! DO NOT stay at this hotel. The staff was extremely rude and borderline offensive. The ROOMS ARE TINY and not worth the money you pay. The rooms also have a terrible draft that make the rooms freezing cold so you will need to sleep in a jacket and pants. Do not make the smae mistake that I did; go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Tiniest room imaginable”
Reviews.Author: DanusBoy
Reviews.Content: I booked through hotels.com and thought it was a decent deal at 170$. The room was clean but extremely small. It was just 6 ft wide and about 7-8 feet long. The bed covered 6ft side from one wall to another and I could barely fit in. I would have shelled out more money if I knew it was going to be this bad. I could not move around without hitting my luggage or table or a wall. Everything was very clean, however. The breakfast was alright and airport drop service was acceptable. Made me feel very claustrophobic, however. No free wifi or internet either. Location was good, very close to various tourist destinations in heart of the city. Also, do not take rental car there. Street parking, if at all available, will be extremely expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Old Fashioned and miserable receptionist”
Reviews.Author: Misscljones
Reviews.Content: To get to this hotel from the airport take bus 197 and it will drop you off just past the hotel, we arrived at hotel late afternoon, the receptionist didn't even ask our name he just gave us a card to fill in (before my stay I emailed the hotel asking for a nice room as it was my 30th birthday). We had very heavy suitcases to carry down a very steep staircase to the basement, we had room 5, the door didn't lock very easily and had a hugh window where people who walked past could look in which wasn't nice being 3 young girls, the wall paper was dirty and needed complete re-decoration! The room was so noisy every night, we stayed 4 nights and wished we had booked The American Hotel, 5 minutes away which was so nice. On the plus side the shower was good and breakfast had a good choice, the older man on reception was very friendly on sunday afternoon, tea/coffee is available free anytime in the hotel (we should have been told this at check in ). The rude receptionist checked us out as well, becareful we were charged more city tax than what our confirmation said! Overall make sure you take lots of money, its very expensive,Anne Frank House is worth a visit but you will have to queue a long time to get in!Amsterdam airport is amazing, so leave extra time for shopping there before you go home.

Reviews.Title: “RAT AND BED BUG INFESTED”
Reviews.Author: MG2010186338
Reviews.Content: Saw a rat in the breakfast area and returned home with severe insect bites and to the extreme expense and stress of realising that we had transported bed bugs from the hotel back to our London home. In addition to which the room was tiny and prison cell-like and walls so thin that we could hear our neighbors getting up to things you REALLY don't want to hear, in the middle of the night. Awful experience. DO NOT STAY HERE.

Reviews.Title: “A decent hotel in a great location at a reasonable price !!”
Reviews.Author: FCB1
Reviews.Content: I don't understand the people who were making all sorts of complaints about this hotel . I just came back from Amsterdam today (27-05-2010) . I stayed at this hotel for two nights and I would definitely go back next time . It is clean,conveniently located to the bus and tram lines . Buses 70,170 & 172 are just a few steps from the hotel's entrance . Any of those buses can take you to the Centraal Station . You can also get off by the Dam square if you wish . Trams #1,2 & 5 are located by Leidseplein la few minutes walk from the hotel . Yes this is NOT a luxury hotel by any means . The noise from the trams can be loud sometimes but you can ask for a room in the back or just bring ear blogs along . The staff were professional and reasonably friendly and helpful . The breakfast was fine . The room was clean with plenty of towels, supplies and extra blankets . This hotel is ideal for someone on a budget . For around 40 Euros per night for a single room you can't go wrong !!

Reviews.Title: “Good if you're in the triple room”
Reviews.Author: vmpiyo
Reviews.Content: There were 3 of us out of the 9 on our trip who stayed in the triple room. Our room was definitely the best, there were 4 single beds, big compared to the the double rooms (which were on the tiny side). Another plus was the new bathroom, which was double the size of the double room bathrooms (which was again very small). Most of the sheets were clean but I noticed on one of the sheets there was some brownish sauce...that put me of sleeping there...but luckily there was the choice of the extra bed. The lift was pretty small, staff were helpful, breakfast was good and location good - there is a tram stop (on the same road) and an information centre close by.

Reviews.Title: “Paid Fee to cancel rather than stay a night”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkGuy421
Reviews.Content: In all my years of travel this place was the worst. They first offered me a room in the basment down stairs so steep carrying a suitcase was dangerous. We were then changed to a room on the top floor -- safe did not work, dingy walls and windows facing cigarette butt filled ledges. Out of the center of the city in a desolate area. Absolutely nothing positive to say about this minus one star hotel. Firsttime I ever chose to pay 60 euros to cancel ratherthan stay even one night. Don't be fooled by the one star rating -- I tried to rate it no stars but it would no accept.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth 3 stars at all !!”
Reviews.Author: Leblon-UK
Reviews.Content: I would say: Think twice before booking this hotel. For just a little bit more euro's you can stay in a real 3 star hotel with a much higher service level and comfort !! When we checked in and went upstairs to the room we smelled a strong hasj smell and we decided to check out same time. Typical ''backpackers'' hotel.

Reviews.Title: “low budget, very good location but pretty noisy”
Reviews.Author: Olli85
Reviews.Content: the location is very good. only few steps from the leidseplein where you can find a lot of bars and restaurants. the staff was not the best one. the price is very cheap. we just payed 54 euros for a double room. you can also take pretty cheap drinks from the hotel bar (2,50 euro for a can of heineken). don't take the breakfast at the hotel. its to expensive and when you walk three minutes to the leidseplein you have many possibilities to find something to eat. don't leave your valuables in your room. i think everybody gets your room key if he asks for it at the reception. the worst thing of the hotel are the noisy rooms. you hear your neighboers and if your room is located to the marnixstraat you hear every car and the many tram lines. sometimes even the bed is rumbling when a tram passes. this is pretty scarry if you have a room at the 4th floor. you definitively need earplugs if you want to have a good sleep. the rooms are pretty small but clean. the beds are very comfortable. the bath room is small too, but very clean and the only modern thing of this hotel. there is an elevator in hotel which is very good. there are no possibilities to park your car. if you travel by car, park it at the car park under the olympic stadium. go with your parking ticket to the office of the car park. there you get tickets for the tram lines for free and for every passenger. you just have to pay 6 euro for every 24 hours. i would recommend this hotel to people who are in amsterdam to have a good party and for people who want a very cheap hotel. don't forget earplugs!

Reviews.Title: “If you don't mind others using your room whilst you are out.........”
Reviews.Author: maccaderby242
Reviews.Content: then this is a good place, decent price, good location, not bad rooms. We came back to our room to find the door open and one of the previously made beds obviously slept in/used or whatever. Nothing was missing but it was very strange and the guy on reception couldnt explain what had happened. We left after that and got a room elsewhere, glad the passports we had left in the room were still there. Strange but disconcerting.

Reviews.Title: “Be prepared to move hotel. They overbook and outsource.”
Reviews.Author: DisneyParisfan
Reviews.Content: Booked to stay there for my 40th birthday. On arrival for check in the 'manager' can't find our reservation, blames the system, then phones another hotel. This is fortunately close by so we walk there. On arrival miraculosly the hotel has been faxed our reservation by the Hotel de Paris. This is the one they hadn't got! Hardly subtle! The replacement hotel was nice, so all in all it wasn't a problem, but that's not the point. What if they had been booked to capacity? Not exactly inspiring confidence to book there again. As is the Hotel de Paris is right on a busy street with trams rolling by the windows. What we saw of it was small and looked like it could do with a clean!

Reviews.Title: “Small but friendly”
Reviews.Author: DunfermlineJag
Reviews.Content: The best thing about the hotel is its location just off Leidesplein and ideal for nightlife museums canal trips - the lot! We had a back room so the only real noise was from other guests obviously enjoying themselves! The staff were exceptionally helpful and we left our bags at reception before check-in and after check-out. The breakfasts were good although the breakfast staff could be a bit picky in asking you to sit where it suited them rather than you. The rooms are small but perfecly adequate and reasonably clean. The layout is awkward and the stairs steep but it is an old property, apparently converted from two houses, so that is to be expected.

Reviews.Title: “dirty and grotty. book somewhere else!”
Reviews.Author: shamyLincolnshire
Reviews.Content: On arrival we were told the two double roms we had booked were not available but we could have two small double rooms with a discount. The staircases to our rooms were too steep to climb, the decor was very dingy with chipped and peeling paint. The room was very small and all the ledges were thick dust. The only good thing about the stay was the breakfast which we enjoyed. We settled our bill and the guy on the desk didn't bother to thank us or say goodbye to us.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for visiting many attractions”
Reviews.Author: Dad45
Reviews.Content: We stayed as a family at the hotel for a few days at the end of October. Its excellent location meant that we could walk to such attractions as the Van Gogh museum and Anne Frank House within a few minutes. We were also able to access a canal trip and Amsterdam centre very quickly. The hotel is quite small as are the rooms but the breakfast is good as is the attention of the staff. The hotel is within walking distance of many good places to eat and we recommend the Fantasia Italian Restaurant just down the road on the opposite side.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Pleasant and Comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: xLauren_88x
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel recently, on a short trip to Amsterdam on my own and i was pleasantly suprised! The distance to the bustling city centre is literally around the corner and so convenient. I had a single room on the first floor, i must say that it was tiny but perfectly decent, well thought about and clean for just a few days away. The staff were fairly friendly and helpful when needs be and very willing to advise you on local attractions, their distances and the best way of getting there. The breakfast really was just average, featuring toast, eggs, hams and pastries etc. But enough to get you on way for a busy day ahead. Overall i really enjoyed staying at this hotel, with it's features and location. I hope to be a regular here every year!

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, 3 star hotel but lack of some services”
Reviews.Author: maniac_the_evil
Reviews.Content: Old building, awful rooms, average food on breakfast, average value for money, not the best hotel in amsterdam but has a great location. The first room was 7 square meters and the bathroom sink was just near the entrance door in the room, with almost no natural light. We've paid 65 euro more for 3 nights to receive another room with 3 beds situated at the 4th floor, and cleanlines was average.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible place, stay away.”
Reviews.Author: alexpar
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed one night at this hotel and paid 120 euros per night per room. We couldn't get the rooms we booked online because of "problems with the system", but they offered to give us other rooms that were already booked for the next day. They said they will transfer the other people to a different hotel. ( Read the other reviews and you will see this actually happened to other travelers ) So we got the rooms we didn't book: My room had a terrible odor coming out of the bathroom and the halls smelled marijuana. The bathroom was poorly cleaned, there was a bunch of hairs in the tub. My friends room was flooded by a water leak in the bathroom that found its way through the floor underneath one of the beds after they showered. Their luggages got all wet. We got a different room for my friends. I kept mine. That same night the first thing we did was to find a different hotel so we can change the next morning. We booked at Marriot not far from Hotel de Paris. The next morning we checked out, and the manager was there. He said textually "So you are leaving just for a water leak? we changed you to a different room what else you want?. Well, we don't like people like you in this hotel anyway". He looked at me and asked "Are you also leaving?...ok good that's very good! " Stay away from this place and go to Marriot, it is 40 euros more expensive but it is worth every penny. It is actually a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A rat !!!”
Reviews.Author: Irises2
Reviews.Content: I stayed there in December 2008. Hotel was very close to the central parts of the city but it was a terrible experience to stay there. The bed sheets were not clean and on the second night of our stay we were disturbed by a rat. When we saw the rat, we called the reception and they were far away from helping. It was 1 am and we couldn't leave the room with our two children and go to another hotel. We had a sleepless night and left very early the next morning. We changed our hotel. However, it's still a very bad feeling to know that we stayed in the same room with a rat for two nights.

Reviews.Title: “great staff, room and location”
Reviews.Author: arcabeleno
Reviews.Content: we wanted to stay in this area and needed a triple room. After lots of search we chose this hotel and wold def. stay again. 24 hour reception, luggage storage, full bathroom with great power shower and a big airy room. For the three of us not to have a complaint is very good! We had a room at the back of the hotel, which reception staff said that is why we couldn't hear the road, we were also asked to keep the noise down as we collected our key when we came in at half 3 one morning which is actually really good

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, small room”
Reviews.Author: Tempe_Sun_Devil
Reviews.Content: I can now say that I have stayed in the smallest room in the world, though it was nice and clean. Hotel Paris is a nice place. The staff was slightly less than friendly. The breakfast was fresh and adequate, but the staff will ask you to leave at 10am sharp. The inn is walking distance from most of Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - staff unfriendly - but wouldnt stop me from staying again”
Reviews.Author: yabraham
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in terms of location and rooms. The rooms were snug but what you would expect in Amsterdam. The only bad thing i could say would be around the staff - they werent overly friendly but not rude either. The breakfast was great and the hotel is in a perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Service”
Reviews.Author: chrissy2121
Reviews.Content: Had booked for one night through Airmiles but when we arrived at reception we were told that due to technical problems the hotel is full and we will be transferred by taxi to a different hotel 'nearby'. The reception staff then lied to us about the other hotel's location. We explained that we wanted to be central and he showed us on a map that the hotel was around the corner. turned out that it was a 15 minute drive (which is a lot for a small city like Amsterdam). Extremely disappointing service. The other hotel was fine, much cleaner and more modern than the outdated, smelly De Paris. However, location was a major disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Please stay away”
Reviews.Author: mp19134
Reviews.Content: Picture you see here are all made up. My dog eats better food than their free meal. When they call taxi for you hotel get 5 euro kick back. I paid 16 euro (underway out) and come back (same distanse)11 euro. I ask taxi driver why and he said this hotel get kick back all the time 5 euro. Room size was 7 feet x 12 feet with 13 inch TV. step is 60 degree angle (you will fall if you are not steping side way). smells like rat hole. Screwed up my whole trip.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Travelator2
Reviews.Content: We had a twin room at the top of the hotel, and a single on second floor. Both were perfectly adequate. Decor perhaps a little faded. Only draw back was some traffic noise on the street at night, but this didn't really worry us. Generous buffet breakfast included in price (many hotels charge extra). Very convenient location for Canal Ring, Leidseplein, museums, on the nicer side of town. Overall good value for money. Tip: hire a bike, its a great way to get around: from 10 euros per day.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: BerBevans
Reviews.Content: We stayed here recently. The Hotel is in an excellent location. It is far enough out of town to be away from the main stag parties and general deborchery that is Amsterdam, but it is close enough to a great tram stop to reach that entertainment with in 5-10 minutes. On top of that the area it is in is full of restaurants and bars. If you are going to Amsterdam for the sex and drugs. This place probably isn't for you (there is a 'coffee shop' across the road) but if you want to see Amsterdam then this is great. My only negative points are: * City Tax is not included in the bill. I knew this was the case from other reviews but I prefer to get it sorted with the main bill. * The walls where a bit thin. Next door had some friends that where also staying in the same hotel so they came to visit and we could here them talking through the walls. Not every word but we could here them. The rooms aren't great but Amsterdam is an expensive city and I think this is great value. Especially considering the location. One final thing, breakfast is great as well.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, good value”
Reviews.Author: jokskot
Reviews.Content: Apart from steep steps - and there is a lift, can't be faulted. We got an excellent deal E55 for two per night through booking dot com.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant little hotel”
Reviews.Author: JKiely
Reviews.Content: Its cheap and cheerful, clean and warm, perfect location - just up the road from leidseplein square - tram stop just a short walkaway. Within walking distance of the Reich Museum and the Heiniken Experience. Whats not to like?

Reviews.Title: “Rat/mouse in the room!”
Reviews.Author: BeliaBela
Reviews.Content: I was at Hotel De Paris Amsterdan from 12th to 15th Oct and a rat/mouse appeared in the room I shared with a friend in 14h during the night. The animal gnawed a bar of Lindt chocolate and slices of orange covered by chocolate that my friend had bought in Lisbon. We called the man at the Reception, but he didnÂ´t go at our room to help us with the rat/mouse. As we went to the Recepction and refused to go back to the bedroom, he offered us another bedroom and help us taking ours bags and suitcases from de rat/mouse's bedroom. The hotel refund 12 euros for the chocolates but didnÂ´t apologize for the trouble. On the contrary, on morning after the "rat attack", the recepcionist said we are acting like children and threatened to call the police if we didn't left the room - it's was 12:10 and we are supposed to do the check out at 12:00, but as we left the other room quickly during the night our bags and suitcases were in a mess and we were late. The man were sarcastic about my country and said that in Brazil didn't have mouses, but big rats. In 13th Oct, Christina Wiklund commented on the Hotels.nl site that there were rat/mouse in her bedroom too(http://www.hotels.nl/amsterdam/deparis/ see the first comment).

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: brianseaman
Reviews.Content: I stayed 5 nights at this hotel on my first (and not last) visit to Amsterdam in early July of 2008. I am familiar with hotel accommodations in Britain and Europe, and can only presume that other reviewers who complained about the small size of the rooms are not used to travelling in this part of the world. Large, North American style rooms may be available in Europe, but you have to stay at large, North American style hotels (eg. Hilton) and can expect to pay a lot more. I liked the full, hot buffet breakfast that is included in the room rental and also found the location to be perfect - only a few minutes walk from the Leidesplein and also within walking distance of Centraal Station, the Damrak and of course, the famous Red Light District. And if you don't feel like walking, there's a bus/tram stop in front of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “liked this hotel a lot.”
Reviews.Author: kellybubblefish
Reviews.Content: The boyfriend and I booked a last minute, reasonably priced deal from a website and were pleased with the room. It was larger than I expected - after staying in several Amsterdam hotels you tend to expect to sleep in tiny box rooms and you could actually walk round this room in the hotel which was pleasing. It also had a safe which I appreciated. One major benefit was the fact we had a balcony overlooking the street which we were on - this was not expected and not asked for and so we felt priviledged. Another major thing was that we turned up four hours before check-in time, expecting to leave our luggage in a little room. However the gentlemen behind the desk asked us to wait five minutes and got our room ready for us which was unbelievably nice, again making us feel very priviledged indeed. The bed (two pushed together to make a double - not the end of the world) was comfy and clean, the room was a smoking one but didn't smell of smoke or have burns everywhere... overall we were pleased. A few negatives - the shower looked old and limescaled and the tray clogged up when we used it, however the actual shower was powerful and hot and did the job. I suppose the cleanliness of the shower was an issue but neither of us died from it so I can't complain really. The sink also leaked when used but that was nothing a towel, put underneath to catch the drips, didn't solve. The taps still worked so it didn't bother us. The only other negative was that the cleaners left a lot of their sheets and whatnot in the hallways, but this was not a major issue. None of the cleaners barged in on us like they have done at other hotels; instead they put a useful "to be cleaned" sign on the door. As for the rest - great elevator (looked new), stairs weren't as bad as I've experienced before, staff were extremely helpful and friendly, no curfew, all-hour bar, decor quirky and i liked it. Overall the hotel was great. I admit the negative aspects of the shower and sink were a bit disheartening but they were easily overlooked by all the positives of the hotel - i.e. the elevator, balcony in the room, the brilliant location of the hotel, and the lovely staff. There is also a bustling bar and a coffeeshop directly opposite the hotel which was great for people like me and the boyf.

Reviews.Title: “Basic Hotel, Fine Experience”
Reviews.Author: ZZZ123
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Amsterdam recently, and we found a good deal at the Hotel de Paris. We stayed there for a few days, and it was a perfectly fine hotel. Nothing fancy, but it was a clean and well-priced place to stay. Here are some pros and cons of the hotel: PROS: --If you want to be in the Leidesplein area, it is a great location. About a 3 minute walk from the Leidseplein (which is full of restaurants and shops). It is about a 10 minute walk to the Rijksmuseum and a 20 minute walk to the Red Light District. --The hotel is on a fairly quiet street, so you won't get rowdy people outside the hotel --You have to be buzzed into the hotel, so it felt safe. There was also a person on duty 24 hours a day --There is a full breakfast each morning, which is very good. --The lobby is small, but has some sofas and places to relax --The rooms are basic but very clean. The beds were comfortable. CONS: --The hotel rooms are *very* small, as are the bathrooms. --The furniture is very basic and there is only a tiny TV on the wall --The doors are VERY thin, so you can hear people in the hallways --The rooms and hallways often smell like smoke (after all, it is Amsterdam) --The stairs are ridiculously narrow and steep (but there is an elevator). --Note that you may end up in a basement room! The stairs are really dangerous, and you can see into the basement rooms from the street. Try to avoid these rooms. Overall, the Hotel de Paris was a fine place to stay for a few days. Hope that helps!

Reviews.Title: “reminded me of my 8x10' dorm room”
Reviews.Author: DB880
Reviews.Content: I knew I was getting a cheap hotel, but for the price I paid (about $185/night for standard room) it should have been a lot better. The room actually felt smaller than my 8x10 dorm room if that's possible. It had two twin beds pushed together and a desk and there was no room to walk in between the beds (or on the other sides of them) nor was there more than a foot in between the beds and the desk. I literally jumped to get in my bed. Hot water really only happened late in the day or at night, so hot showers in the morning didn't happen. The bathtub and the bathroom sink were both clogged. And the maids woke us up if we were still asleep past 9:30-10pm. She'd give one knock and then already be in the room and when we said come back later she insisted on emptying the trash cans and dropping off towels (onto the bed I was sleeping in) anyway. Wouldn't stay here again that's for sure. The only pro is that it's walkable to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, for the price I suppose”
Reviews.Author: Olive88
Reviews.Content: As this hotel stay cost very little for 2 nights B&B (about 140 each) I shouldnt really moan but if you are looking for a stay in a nice, classy hotel the Hotel de Paris is somewhere I wouldnt really recommend! The staff are not very friendly at all and the rooms are similar to those found in a ship cabin. As i generally found the city a bit uncomfortable I think this made the hotel seem worse than it actually was. The breakfast was quite limited and not the freshest and the staff were keen to get you out of the way and tidy up. On the plus side the hotel is in a very good central location All in all I dont think I would go back to Amsterdam and if I did i would be trying a different hotel As previously stated though, it was cheap so what can you expect?

Reviews.Title: “Good Location / Bad Room”
Reviews.Author: GiggaMan
Reviews.Content: I was here for two nights and can confirm that even two years ago this place was not good, and I am a young guy who dosen't mind shabbiness. The location is grat your right in the middle of the square and you also have the tram closely located. However it seemed like a room out of an old 70's sitcom. If your in a bind this place will do, but if you got options go with the others.

Reviews.Title: “Submarine-size quarters”
Reviews.Author: DelphiPhryne
Reviews.Content: I rented a 'single' room. I could stand in the room and almost touch both walls with my fingertips, No exageration! ( I'm 5ft 5in) The head of the bed was against wall streetside, and next to an airconditioner. Noise and the drip drip drip of AC was like Chinese torture. Manager was unable to relocate me.The couple travelling with me had a larger room and thought it was 'okay'. I chose it because it was inexpensive and close to Leidseplein. Beware! Avoid the 'single bed rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this "hotel"”
Reviews.Author: rebel2
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 3 nights......... the room we were given was miniscule. It was up in the attic area and was very warm and stuffy. We had to keep the windows open at night and the noise from the trams and the bar across the street was very annoying. The pictures posted by the hotel of their bedrooms on the website bore no ressemblance whatsoever to the room we were given. I believe our room wasnt cleaned once during the duration of our stay.......... then again it would have been hard to get a hoover in the room to do any cleaning. The only upside of the room was the ensuite..... it appeared to be recently revamped and the shower was good. Breakfast was adequate.... nothing to rave about. This "hotel" is in an ideal location but then so are many more hotels around the vicinity. If I had read the reviews on here before booking this "hotel" I would have avoided it like the plague. I would definetly say this "hotel" is one to avoid at all cost. If it were possible I would give this one a minus rating of -5.0.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: uklkb
Reviews.Content: I often laugh at some of the reviews calling rooms in Europe "small" because compared to American standards, they often are. Well, this defied all standards of small. We could open one suitcase at a time, and if a suitcase was open on the floor, you could not get in (or out) of the bathroom because you were blocking the door. My family was in the same hotel, and their rooms were not as bad, but for what we got, we definitely paid too much. The fire alarm also went off in the middle of the night because, apparently, someone was taking a shower with the door open and the steam set it off. My advice: keep looking.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, average price”
Reviews.Author: spacemonkeymafia
Reviews.Content: We had a good experience here! I am not very picky about hotels, but I can honestly say this was a pleasant stay. The lobby was being remodeled, which didn't bother us. Staff was friendly and helpful. On our last morning we got a shuttle to the airport from the hotel, which was also fine. Didn't try the breakfast (if they had one?) so can't comment on that. Overall, though, the stay was nice and the location was great. You can probably find a better hotel deal in Amsterdam, but I booked last minute.

Reviews.Title: “a great stay may 11th to 14th”
Reviews.Author: stretch61
Reviews.Content: I stayed there with my partner and friends of ours it was ok for what we payed. It was only 2mins from Liedsplien sq, where the tram stopped just down on the right. We were there to sleep, shower and get ready for the night ahead. The breakfast was basic, the staff were'nt that bad. You could'nt take the hotel key with you, it had to be left behind reception. they did have someone on the desk 24hrs, so when you came in day or night you had to buzz, which was good because no strangers were aloud in. the tram from the station to Liedsplien was the no5 and took about 10mins. You could walk to most places if you wanted or get the tram, which was about 1.50 euros. The city of Amsterdam was great. We all said we would stay there again. So do'nt believe every thing you read, just go and have fun.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: zcomments
Reviews.Content: This is THE WORST hotel I have ever stayed in. And I cannot understand how can ANY agency offer this dirty pigeon hole. I am sorry that I have recently deleted photos of this anti-hotel which is not worth 1 euro, And on top of that, the staff is unfriendly, pretends not to understand English when ou complain and they are not willing to help at all. My opinion share other 8 people who stayed in this hole. I regret each cent I have spent there. And it is not in centre ! It is in the street where you can feel every little car passing by.

Reviews.Title: “(from uk) not that bad, good coffee shop across the road”
Reviews.Author: dj_bishop
Reviews.Content: me and a friend stayed at this hotel for 4 days, the hotel was very basic with a not so helpful manager. the lift was prehistoric and took me 5 mins to work out how to open the door. nearly broke my neck walking down the stairs but honestly we only used the hotel to sleep and wash.. amsterdam is for sight-seeing.... and tasting... if you know what i mean. ps... there is a good coffee shop right across the road.

Reviews.Title: “pretty good”
Reviews.Author: Larnkyland
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for three nights, and I guess it just depends on how much you paid for this hotel. When I stayed I paid a little less than 100 dollars per night, which I think is pretty good for amsterdam. The reason they classify this hotel as a three star hotel is probably the location, because the hotel itself is nothing special. Location was perfect for me, and I actually enjoyed walking to most places where the attractions are. Also, it was a nice relief to get away from an American style hotel. This hotel was smaller and I liked that aspect of it. Yes, the stairs are steep especially if you are carrying luggage, but unless you have a disability, or are really old, you should be ok. I actually liked the stairs, they were different! I like different! The rooms are very basic. We had two beds put together and that was ok by me. The beds were comfortable enough, and I really didn't hear any outside noise. The bathrooms were perfectly fine as well. The front desk person was always extremely friendly. I didn't catch his name, but he was an older gentleman that always smiled. If you get a good deal, I would highly recommend this hotel. If you can't find anything around 100 dollars or less, I might try another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I can't understand why all the bad reviews”
Reviews.Author: H-Gt-Harwood.
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel with two friends to stay for 2 nights in a three bed room, then I read the reviews and I thought I had made a big mistake. On arriving at the hotel I remembered someone saying to ask for a room upstairs and avoid the basement. I asked but as the hotel was fully booked we had to go into the basement room number 2, I was getting ready to be dissapointed. On entering I could not beleive how clean and up to date the rooms were, three very comfortable single beds, air conditioning and digital safe both free of charge, lcd tv, clean well kept bathroom very hot and powerfull shower, fresh towels everyday, as much soap and shower gel as you would want. The room was big enough for three of us and the bathroom was big enough being tiled from floor to ceiling and the room having wooden flooring. The breakfast was ok consisting of a selection of meats, cheese and breads, boiled egg, tea, coffee and orange juice and you could have as much as you want. Overall I was impressed with the hotel and the staff who were helpfull and friendly and would stay here again. The people who have written the previous reviews cannot be living in the real world, this hotel is not what they are saying it is. The only bad thing I have to say is it was a little noisy when they were doing the breakfast as we where directly underneath, I would not expect it to be like this upstairs, but it acted as an alarm call to get up for breakfast. We paid 45 pounds each for the room for 2 nights including breakfast, 22.50p per night, come on folks lets be fair.

Reviews.Title: “Really bad. I mean really, REALLY bad.”
Reviews.Author: Titters
Reviews.Content: Overpriced dump. Filthy room, phone didn't work, sink and shower didn't drain, television blurry, LOUD street noise, LOUD hall door, tiny bed, gross breakfast...the list goes on and on.

Reviews.Title: “not that bad”
Reviews.Author: styxchik
Reviews.Content: It was not that bad. So the steps are steep. We only had to use them once, going down. The breakfast was filling and basic: coffee, juice, meat, cheese, bread... Our room was a Quad and just fine for us. We are a family of 4 w/ 2 teenagers. The walk from the tram to the hotel was a bit much when arriving from Central Station but after that, the tram 2 blocks the other way was a breeze! The price was a bit high for us but I couldn't find anything cheaper. I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “worse than we expected”
Reviews.Author: thehommefatal
Reviews.Content: If you are planning to stay at this hotel, do verify first that they are not going give you a room at the basement! It is a shame for a 3 star hotel. We had the curtains closed the whole time so as people walking outside (along a busy street) could not see us. There was not a lift and the stairs were steep. itÂ´s a pity paying a good amount of money and not having a decent view in amsterdam. Its location was nice, but still you can find many other hotels with better amenities and the same amount charged. Breakfast was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this one”
Reviews.Author: Duncampin
Reviews.Content: Really pokey room, cold (in April). When they say there is a plasma TV in every room, that's because there's no room for a tube TV. Our room had no lift to it (is this 3 stars ?) and very steep stairs. The sagging bed was jammed up against a radiator which varied from freezing to dangerously hot. No hot water one morning. Breakfast very limited. Canned Heineken was the only beer in the bar. Full advertised twin room rate is 160 euros per night - this is laughable. The only good point is proximity to Leidsplein (but that's nothing to do with the hotel)

Reviews.Title: “good Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: For the price we paid this hotel was a bargain. It's in a great location, a couple of minutes walk from leidesplein. The rooms were not huge but they were clean and well equipped for what we needed them for (a change of clothes and sleep!) The shower was excellent! For a quiet hotel, close to bars and attractions but not in the seedy hub of Amsterdam this is the perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “the price was right”
Reviews.Author: peterinannarbor
Reviews.Content: after reading some of the reviews here, i was very concerned about my anticipated six-day stay, but found the hotel to be entirely adequate. nothing about the place is premium quality, but with very few exceptions, i found the place satisfactory. the breakfast is nothing to write home about, nor the appointments and amenities, and indeed hot water ran out one morning, but the place was clean, the staff was friendly, and the price -- â‚¬60/night -- was right.

Reviews.Title: “Hmmmmm Not Again I don't think”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Well, errr yeah... reasonable enough to be in other than there was no hot water on day 2 of our stay and the bar is err well shall we say limited to say the least. only serving canned beer, tango or Cola.... No Tea or Coffee facilities in the room.. Very Very bland. All that said we really enjoyed the location as it is just a stones throw from Leidseplein, which in our opinion has to be one of the best places to stay near!

Reviews.Title: “decent enough”
Reviews.Author: clarissa_uk
Reviews.Content: we came here in may 2004 and it was perfect was us we just wanted to somewhere to crash near the nightlife and sightseeing. the rooms were dated but clean, our bathroom was clean and everything was in order. it worked out at about 15pound a night per person based on 3 sharing so i knew it wasnt going to be the ritz carlton. for the price i would stay here again but if i could afford more when i return to amsterdam i would pay extra and get something a bit more comfy. but for stag do's - perfect. wouldnt recommend to coupled on a romantic getaway. also we found the reception and bar staff to be extremely friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal situation and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location near Leidsplein. We were 4 couples late forties and enjoyed our stay. Having read previous reviews I can only imagine it has changed dramatically. The rooms are small but are cleaned every day and the bathroom and shower are a suitable size. Breakfast is basic but was what we expected. The staff were friendly and helpful and arranged transport for us when leaving. The night porter who served at the bar was very friendly and couldn't do enough for us. One thing, use the lift as the stairs are very steep. If you are looking for a base to explore Amsterdam it is ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Biggest Hovel in Holland”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Booked over the net for 3 nights from 11th march 2005. Looked so good in the photo. We are 2 couples in our forties and we should have known better than to book before we had read any reviews on wonderful sites like these. We arrived on a cold wet night at 8pm, and first impressions from the ouside and reception was good. It was oldie worldy looking, just how i imagined an Amsterdam Hotel. We were given the keys to our rooms and went upstairs. (just writing this 4 days later and i can hear that music from the film were the girl is gonna get knifed in the shower)! The hallway and the rooms were FILTHY. The rooms were tiny, the bathrooms stank, and there was not enough room to hang hardly any clothes. We did not even unpack. When my mate wrote his name in the dust on the carpet and we pulled back the sheets on the bed and saw all THOSE stains, we knew we could not stay for one night. No one in thier right minds could say this is a nice hotel. They should not be allowed to call it a one star let alone 3 star. Dont listen to the good reviews on this hotel, they have got to be a wind up. Dont go there...I beg you!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Disgraceful!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This Hotel (if I can call it that!!!) was an absolute disgrace and I am ashamed to admit that I fell for their advertising campaign!! I am also sure that a few people on this site are having fun with users by posting FALSE reviews of this hotel. How anyone can say this was a good hotel is beyond me. We walked into our room and were shocked and speachless at what we got for what we were paying! The room was tiny, the double bed was a single bed, the carpet smelt, the top sheet was stained, the staff were rude and obnoxious and the breakfast I wouldn't feed to my dog! I sat on the toilet and bruised my knees as they hit the door of the toilet! That is how small this bathroom in this HOSTEL is!!!! The location was great but there are many hotels around the Leidelsplein that you could stay at for a cheaper rate and be a hell of a lot more comfortable!!! If you read this review and still stay at this Hotel then you must have rocks in your head!!! IT IS AN ABSOLUTE DIVE! It is not a 3 star hotel, it is a very bad Hostel!!!! DON'T STAY AT THIS HOTEL!!!!

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel De Paris Amsterdam
HotelInfo.Address: Marnixstraat 372, Amsterdam 1012 LK, The Netherlands
